float get_lin_vel (void)
 Calculates the linear velocity based on the height of the surrounding BBox of the detected human The current BBox height is used to compute a linear gain by normailzation. BBox height is between 430 (top speed) and 800 (0 speed) give 1 -> 0 linear velocity. More...

 Calculates the linear and angular velocity based on the gains defined in the config.yaml file. More...
 
void pub_pid (void)
 Publishes the setpoint (0.0) and the current state (image_width/2 - human_pos_x) to the ROS PID. More...

Detailed Description

Human platooning package of the UAS Technikum Wien.

This is the baseclass of the human platooning package.

Author
Georg Novotny
UAS Technikum Vienna
Version
1.0
Date
2019
Precondition
First launch the corresponding launchfiles.
Bug:
PID Controller currently not working
Copyright
GNU Public License.

Member Function Documentation

void follow_human::callback_img ( const sensor_msgs::ImageConstPtr &  msg)
private

Callback of the corresponding image stream to the callback_yolo. Only used to determine the image width and height. Subscriber is shutdown after this.

Parameters
<msg>Pointer to the current image of the stream.

Definition at line 154 of file follow_human.cpp.

void follow_human::callback_lidar ( const sensor_msgs::LaserScan &  scan)
private

Callback function to process the laser data of the front mounted LIDAR to detect obstacles and stop bevore them. Only execute when going forward.

Parameters
<scan>Laserscan message of the front LIDAR

Definition at line 120 of file follow_human.cpp.

void follow_human::callback_pid ( const std_msgs::Float64 &  msg)
private

Callback of the PID Controller. Used to generate the angular velocity based on the control effort of the PID algorithm. Linear velocity is calculated using <get_lin_vel>.

Parameters
<msg>Control effort calculated by the PID controller
Bug:
Currently only returns MAX and MIN values
Todo:
Fix bug

Updates the config params of the explorer node.

Parameters

void follow_human::callback_yolo ( const darknet_ros_msgs::BoundingBoxes &  bboxes)
private

Parameters
<bboxes>BoundingBox message of the darknet_ros_msgs package

Definition at line 34 of file follow_human.cpp.

float follow_human::get_lin_vel ( void  )
private

Calculates the linear velocity based on the height of the surrounding BBox of the detected human The current BBox height is used to compute a linear gain by normailzation. BBox height is between 430 (top speed) and 800 (0 speed) give 1 -> 0 linear velocity.

Returns
<lin_vel> [float] Returns the calculated linear velocity ranging from 0 to 1
